main event: A senior government analyst observed a cigar-shaped pale yellow flame in the sky near Detroit, Michigan on July 4, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as a cigar-shaped flame,The observer saw the exhaust of the object and not the object itself,The object veered at a 75-degree angle and then moved south while climbing,The observation lasted for approximately 3 minutes,The analyst was previously employed by Chrysler Missile and ruled out aircraft or fireworks.
witness description: senior government analyst from Detroit, formerly employed by Chrysler Missile
